name: articles-205686967
content:
{"name":"This section is only visible to your agents","title":"This section is only visible to your agents","body":"

If you can see this, you must be an agent or a Help Center manager. End-users can't see it. A restriction has been placed on the section so that only agents can see it. To find out how it's done, see Restricting access to content.

This kind of restriction creates a private area in the Help Center just for agents. Use it to provide agents with the internal documents they need to do their job.

"}

name: articles-205686977
content:
{"name":"Sample agent guidelines","title":"Sample agent guidelines","body":"

These are guidelines that this section might contain to help agents solve tickets. You can adapt the article to your support workflows or delete it.

Is the question answered in the knowledge base?

Check the knowledge base for answers to most common questions.

Has somebody answered this question before?

It's possible that somebody solved the same issue in the past. Search past tickets or community discussions for a solution.

"}

name: articles-205686907
articles-205686917
articles-205686927
content:
{"name":"What are these sections and articles doing here?","title":"What are these sections and articles doing here?","body":"

This FAQ is a section in the General category of the Help Center. We created this category and a few common sections to help you get started with your Help Center. You'll want to delete our content before you activate your Help Center.

The knowledge base in the Help Center consists of three main page types: category pages, section pages, and articles. Here's the structure:

You can add your own content and modify or completely delete our content. See the Contributor guide to the Help Center to learn how.

"}

name: articles-205686937
content:
{"name":"How do I customize my Help Center?","title":"How do I customize my Help Center?","body":"

You can quickly change the look and feel of the Help Center using simple WYSIWYG tools such as color pickers and font choosers. You can also change the way your content is organized with a few mouse clicks by using themes. If you're comfortable working with page code, you can dig into the site's HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

\n\n

To get started, see Customizing the Help Center.

"}

name: articles-205686947
content:
{"name":"How do I publish my content in other languages?","title":"How do I publish my content in other languages?","body":"

Here's the workflow for localizing your Help Center in other languages:

  1. Get your content translated in the other languages.
  2. Configure the Help Center to support all your languages.
  3. Add the translated content to the Help Center.

For instructions, see Localizing the Help Center.

"}

name: articles-205686957
content:
{"name":"Help, I have a question and I need an answer","title":"Help, I have a question and I need an answer","body":"

Like your own Help Center, the Help Center on the Zendesk website is designed to provide a complete self-service support option -- for your Help Center.

\n\n

You can search our knowledge base and community for a solution, or ask community members directly. If you can't find an answer, you can submit a request to an agent. For more information, see the Zendesk Help Center.

"}
